questions.questionText: Which hormone is primarily responsible for regulating blood sugar levels?
questions.explanation: Insulin is the primary hormone that regulates blood glucose levels by facilitating cellular glucose uptake.

questions.questionText: What is the most common cause of community-acquired pneumonia?
questions.explanation: Streptococcus pneumoniae (pneumococcus) is the most common bacterial cause of community-acquired pneumonia.

questions.questionText: Which ECG finding is most characteristic of hyperkalemia?
questions.explanation: Peaked T waves are the earliest and most characteristic ECG finding in hyperkalemia.
